headline: Lava Cake
description: Lava cake is a decadent individual dessert served warm to reveal a molten chocolate center. It may just be the best chocolate dessert you've ever had!
name: Lava Cake
recipeIngredient: 6.5 (1 ounce) squares semisweet chocolate, finely chopped

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease and flour four 6-ounce ramekins.

Place chocolate and butter in the top of a double boiler over simmering water. Stir frequently, scraping down the sides with a rubber spatula to avoid scorching, until chocolate is melted, about 5 minutes.

Combine eggs and sugar in a large bowl; beat with an electric mixer until pale and thick, about 5 minutes. Mix in melted chocolate, flour, and cocoa powder until combined. Pour batter into the prepared ramekins and place on a baking tray.
Bake in the preheated oven until the sides are set but the middle is still jiggly, 10 to 13 minutes. Let cool for 5 minutes before serving.

review.reviewBody: It was absolutely delicious. The baking is the difficult part. So Iâ€™ve made it 3 times and once it was over cooked. I used old fashioned custard cups and added a circle of greased parchment paper to the bottom of the cup and they came out easily.
I wanted to test this recipe, I give it a 2 star, not worth it, waste of ingredients. Definitely not lava cake very disappointed ðŸ˜ž . I've made lava cake that flow
Sooo good! My daughter made these for me for my birthday! I loooved them. She said that she added a bit more chocolate to them and they were perfect.
This recipe is so chocolaty and gooy, where it's supposed to be, like lava cake. It was so easy to make and so delicious. I prepared it just as directed and cooked it for 11 minutes. Perfection!
Great chocolate flavor. I used chocolate chips. Easy to make if you melt the butter & chocolate chips in the microwave. I cooked it in the oven for 12 minutes. I will make it again.
Turned out tasting delicious! But after cooking for about 10 min, it no longer had a jiggly center. Still tasted scrumptious!
Rich, chocolatey goodness! We will definitely make this again. I made the recipe for 4 servings, but because it was so rich, will divide into six smaller servings next time.
Turned out well, except center did not flow, could have been how I mixed things.
Next time Iâ€™ll try adding a little more baking chocolate. Also, slightly less baking time
Used less chocolate because my son doesnâ€™t like it too chocolaty.
It was our Valentine dessert! Wonderful!
Hi this was an amazing cake I had to make a dessert for class and I did not know what to do and I saw this! It was soooo yummy and everyone loved it

Great for a fast chocolate fix! Easy to follow recipe. Delicious. My teen daughter made these for us. Only changes: used 6 smaller ramekins, and used the microwave to melt butter/chocolate instead of a double boiler. Will definitely make again.
